briefdescription.para: Maps each Maple pin to a corresponding stm32_pin_info.
Array of pins capable of analog input.
Pins which are connected to external hardware.

detaileddescription.para: For example, on Maple boards, it always at least includes BOARD_LED_PIN. Its length is BOARD_NR_USED_PINS.
This function is called before main(). It ensures that the clocks and peripherals are configured properly for use with wirish, then calls boardInit().
This function is called from init() after all generic board initialization has been performed. Each board is required to define its own.

briefdescription.para: Test if a pin is used for a special purpose on your board.

simplesect.para: true if the given pin is in boardUsedPins, and false otherwise.

Bryan Newbold <bnewbold@leaflabs.com>, Marti Bolivar <mbolivar@leaflabs.com> To add a new board type, add a new pair of files to /wirish/boards/, update the section below with a new "BOARD" type, and update /wirish/rules.mk to include your boards/your_board.cpp file in the top-level Makefile build.
